elements.text: Another day, another Python memory leak

text: Is that a Python gripe or a Julia gripe?

elements.text: Is that a Python gripe or a Julia gripe?

text: I can't tell if this is in the context of using Python from Julia or not :slightly_smiling_face:

elements.text: I can't tell if this is in the context of using Python from Julia or not

text: Ahh no, this is most definitely a Python gripe :smile:

elements.text: Ahh no, this is most definitely a Python gripe

text: An update to Numpy causes a deprecation warning in scikit learn. And obviously warnings in Numpy/Pandas cause memory leaks.. Because Python

elements.text: An update to Numpy causes a deprecation warning in scikit learn. And obviously warnings in Numpy/Pandas cause memory leaks.. Because Python

text:
I heard this from a colleague and assumed it was true, but on further digging, it seems to be a false positive in a memory leak test caused by PyTest:
<https://github.com/pytest-dev/pytest/issues/5642>
that happens when warnings are raised (which Pandas/Numpy do a lot of)

elements.text: I heard this from a colleague and assumed it was true, but on further digging, it seems to be a false positive in a memory leak test caused by PyTest:
that happens when warnings are raised (which Pandas/Numpy do a lot of)

text: still a pain in the butt, but I guess I can't blame Pandas for that

elements.text: still a pain in the butt, but I guess I can't blame Pandas for that

text: thank you for following up on this once it turned out to be false :)

elements.text: thank you for following up on this once it turned out to be false :)
